article.title: Simultaneous baldness and cosmic baldness and Kottler spacetime

multiple_choice_question.text: What spacetime solution does formula (1.1) represent?
What is the significance of formula (2.14) in the context of the article?
choices: It describes the metric of a rotating black hole.
It demonstrates the existence of wormholes.
It proves the uniqueness of the Kottler/Schwarzschild-de Sitter solution.
It defines a new type of coordinate system for curved spacetimes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the conclusion the article draws regarding the metric presented in formula (3.1)?
choices: It represents a genuinely new solution to the Einstein equations.
It is equivalent to the Kottler/Schwarzschild-de Sitter solution in a different coordinate system.
It violates the assumptions of the Jebsen-Birkhoff theorem.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does formula (4.16) imply about the evolution of the spacetime in the presence of radial inflow (q < 0)?
choices: The spacetime collapses to a singularity in finite time.
The spacetime expands forever, approaching a de Sitter state.
The spacetime oscillates between periods of expansion and contraction.
The spacetime forms a stable wormhole.
